suggestedNewContent.title: Important: Named Routes Limitations
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Cover the official Flutter team position that named routes are no longer recommended for most apps. Explain limitations: no browser forward button support, rigid deep linking behavior, no customization of navigation stack. Recommend go_router or basic Navigator.push as alternatives.

suggestedNewContent.title: Complete Named Routes Setup
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Provide a full working example showing: MaterialApp with initialRoute and routes, multiple screens, navigation between them, and passing/receiving arguments. Include runnable code with imports.

suggestedNewContent.title: Returning Data from Named Routes
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show how Navigator.pushNamed returns a Future, how to await results, and how to use Navigator.pop with return values. Essential for practical navigation flows.

suggestedNewContent.title: When to Use Named Routes vs Alternatives
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Decision guide: Use basic Navigator.push for simple apps, named routes for medium apps without deep linking needs, go_router for production apps with deep linking/web requirements. Include comparison table.

suggestedNewContent.title: Introduction to go_router (Modern Approach)
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Brief introduction to go_router as the Flutter team's recommended routing package. Show equivalent patterns to named routes. Include basic setup example and link to go_router documentation.

reviewNotes: This lesson teaches a pattern that Flutter officially no longer recommends for most applications. While the technical content is mostly accurate, the lesson presents named routes as 'the solution' without acknowledging their significant limitations and deprecated status. For a tutorial platform, this could lead learners to adopt patterns they'll need to migrate away from in production apps. The lesson should be updated to either (1) clearly position named routes as a legacy/learning pattern while teaching go_router as the modern approach, or (2) restructure the navigation module to teach go_router primarily with named routes as historical context.
